item.description:
Our guest speaker will be Ken Feder, professor of Archaeology at Central Connecticut State University (not to mention text book author, field archaeologist, etc.).

Ken's latest talk will be entitled "Archaeological Odysseys: The 50 Sites in the United States You Should See Before You Die"

He says this about the talk:

In his work, The Go Between, English novelist L.P. Hartley phrased it this way: “The past is a foreign country; they do things differently there.”
Following this metaphor, in a sense, an important goal of every archaeologist is to serve as a tour guide to non-archaeologists who hope to visit the “foreign country” that is the past. In this lecture, I'll attempt to serve as your tour guide and direct you to at least some of the 50 sites that I think are the most important and the most interesting for you to experience first hand.

We'll start with a half hour of coffee and conversation at 7:30 p.m. and the main talk will follow brief announcements at 8:00 PM.

For more information about this event and others, please read the write-up on our home page.
item.how_to_find_us: We will most probably be in the Social Hall near the main entrance.
item.name: Monthly Meeting: Ken Feder on Archaeological Odysseys
